text:
Professor's Note: The key to remembering how measures of central tendency are
affected by skewed data is to recognize that skew affects the mean more than the
median and mode, and the mean is "pulled" in the direction of the skew. The
relative location of the mean, median, and mode for different distribution shapes
is shown in Figure 5. Note the median is between the other two measures for
positively or negatively skewed distributions.
